500px: An online network for photographers that helps them share and discover photos, gain exposure, and license their work. It achieves this through a platform that uses an algorithm to surface new photos and photographers, provides tools for building a professional presence, and offers statistics to track performance.
adidas: A manufacturer of a range of clothing items, including t-shirts, jackets, and pants, with a focus on sports apparel and equipment. It also produces specially designed footballs for major international tournaments and has sponsored a variety of athletes and teams across different sports.
adobe: A technology company specializing in software tools for digital media creation and digital marketing. It provides essential tools for graphic designers, publishers, and artists through products that facilitate consistent document display and other creative processes.
aer-lingus: An airline that connects a particular country with the rest of the world using a fleet of modern aircraft. It serves international routes to destinations in Europe and the US and maintains high levels of customer service by using technology to communicate with passengers about delays and cancellations.
aetna: An American managed health care company that sells various health care insurance and related services, such as medical, pharmaceutical, and dental plans. Its network includes a large number of medical and dental members, health-care professionals, and hospitals.
aiesec: An international youth-run, non-governmental, and not-for-profit organization that provides young people with business development and teaching internships. It focuses on empowering young people to make a progressive social impact by facilitating leadership development and cultural exchange programs.
airbus: A European aerospace corporation that primarily designs and manufactures commercial aircraft, and also has separate divisions for defense, space, and helicopters. The company operates offices and assembly plants in multiple countries.
alcon: A global eye care device company with complementary businesses in surgical and vision care. It offers products for cataract, retinal, and refractive surgery, as well as a wide range of contact lenses, lens care products, and ocular health products.
algolia: A hosted search engine that delivers real-time results from the first keystroke. It provides an API for seamless search implementation in websites and applications, using a tie-breaking algorithm and various criteria to order results based on relevance.
alienware: A computer hardware brand that creates products dedicated to gaming computers and accessories, which are known for their alien-themed designs. It benefits from the purchasing power and supply chain of its parent company, allowing it to lower its operating costs.
american-red-cross: A humanitarian organization that prevents and alleviates human suffering in emergencies by mobilizing volunteers and donors. It provides disaster relief by sheltering, feeding, and comforting people affected by disasters, and also supplies a significant portion of a nation's blood, teaches life-saving skills, and supports veterans and military families.
amp: An electronic device that can increase the magnitude of an electrical signal. It is a two-port electronic circuit that uses power from a supply to increase the amplitude of a signal applied to its input terminals, producing a proportionally greater signal at its output.
arriva: A pan-European passenger transport operator that provides a variety of services including bus, train, coach, and tram services. It operates locally managed businesses across the UK and mainland Europe with the goal of improving passenger transport.
asana: A cloud-based task management solution that allows businesses to manage, collaborate, and organize tasks and projects. It helps teams coordinate work by providing features like task assignment, custom fields, and timeline views, and also allows for the automation of manual processes.
atlanta-falcons: A professional American football team based in Atlanta that competes in the National Football League (NFL) as a member of the National Football Conference (NFC) South division. The team has appeared in two Super Bowls and has compiled a record of winning division championships.
atos: A measure of readability, which is a formula designed to guide students to appropriate-level books. The formula takes into account factors such as average sentence length, average word length, and word difficulty level.
audi: A German automotive manufacturer of luxury vehicles. It produces vehicles in multiple production facilities worldwide and is among the best-selling luxury automobile brands in the world.
auth0: A flexible, drop-in solution that adds authentication and authorization services to applications. It helps teams and organizations avoid the cost and time of building their own user management solutions by providing features like single sign-on (SSO), multi-factor authentication (MFA), and passwordless login.
avast: A cybersecurity software that offers protection against malware and other threats. It provides features like manual and automatic scans, phishing protection, a firewall for monitoring network traffic, and real-time protection that runs in the background to block threats.
basecamp: A team that creates simple, focused software to help people collaborate and get organized. The products are designed to be intentionally less complex than competitors, offering features like message boards, to-do lists, and file sharing to manage projects.
bing: A search engine operated by a technology company that provides various search services, including web, image, video, and news search.
blackberry: A Canadian technology company known for designing and manufacturing mobile phones and software. It specializes in secure enterprise mobility and offers a variety of software solutions for businesses and governments, including products for enterprise mobility management, instant messaging, and cyber security.
blockchain: A type of distributed ledger technology that securely records transactions across many computers. It creates a tamper-resistant and transparent record of transactions, which is updated with new blocks of information in a linear, chronological order. This technology is used for cryptocurrencies, supply chain management, and other applications.
boise-state-university: A public research university located in Idaho. It is the largest university in the state and offers a wide range of academic programs at the undergraduate and graduate levels, including doctoral research programs. The university is also known for its research in various fields.
booking-com: A travel fare aggregator and travel metasearch engine that helps users find and book accommodations, flights, and other travel-related services. It operates a large marketplace for travel and is available in many languages and countries.
bower: A package manager for web development. It manages the dependencies for front-end web development projects by fetching and installing packages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript libraries from a repository.
british-airways: A flag carrier airline of the United Kingdom. It operates a global network of flights to hundreds of destinations, primarily from its hubs at Heathrow and Gatwick airports. It offers both short-haul and long-haul international flights.
british-telecommunications: A telecommunications company that provides a range of services, including landline, broadband, and mobile services. It operates an extensive network in a particular country and also provides managed network services to businesses and government organizations globally.
buffer: A social media management platform that helps individuals and businesses manage their social media presence. It provides tools for scheduling posts, analyzing performance, and engaging with audiences across multiple social media platforms.
burger-king: A global chain of fast-food restaurants that specializes in serving hamburgers and other fast-food items. The company operates a large number of restaurants worldwide and is known for its signature flame-grilled burgers.
carrefour: A multinational retail corporation that operates a large chain of hypermarkets, supermarkets, and convenience stores. The company is one of the largest retailers in the world and has a presence in many countries across Europe, Asia, and Latin America.
carrot: A mobile application that rewards users for walking and being active. It tracks users' activity and provides them with points that can be redeemed for various rewards, such as gift cards and products.
cartoon-network: An American cable television channel that broadcasts animated television shows, primarily aimed at children and adolescents. It is known for its original animated series, as well as for airing a variety of other animated content.
case-mate: A company that designs and manufactures a variety of accessories for mobile devices, including phone cases, screen protectors, and other accessories. The products are often known for their stylish and protective designs.
channel-4: A public-service television broadcaster in the United Kingdom. It broadcasts a wide range of content, including news, documentaries, dramas, and entertainment shows. The broadcaster is commercially funded and has a unique remit to innovate and take creative risks.
charity-water: A non-profit organization that provides clean and safe drinking water to people in developing countries. It raises money to fund water projects, such as drilling wells and installing water filtration systems, and uses a transparent model to show how donations are spent.
clemson-university: A public research university located in South Carolina. It offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs and is known for its strong programs in science, engineering, and agriculture.
cloob: An online social networking service that allows users to create profiles, connect with friends, and share content. It is popular in a specific region and provides features similar to other social networks, such as photo sharing, messaging, and group creation.
cloudflare: A web infrastructure and website security company that provides content delivery network services, DDoS mitigation, and other services to improve website performance and security. It acts as a reverse proxy for websites, routing traffic through its network to protect against online threats.
cnbc: An American pay television business news channel that provides coverage of business and financial markets. It broadcasts live market coverage during the business day and provides financial news and analysis.
cnn: A multinational news channel that provides 24-hour news coverage from around the world. It broadcasts breaking news, live events, and analysis on various topics, including politics, world affairs, and entertainment.
codepen: An online community for front-end developers and designers. It allows users to write and share code snippets, known as 'Pens', which can be used to experiment with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a social development environment.
continental-ag: A German multinational automotive parts manufacturing company that specializes in a variety of components, including tires, brake systems, and interior electronics. It is a major supplier to the automotive industry.
courtyard: A hotel brand that offers a variety of accommodations for business and leisure travelers. The hotels are designed with a focus on providing comfortable and productive stays, with features such as business centers, meeting spaces, and fitness facilities.
creative-commons: A non-profit organization that provides public copyright licenses that enable the free distribution of copyrighted works. The licenses allow creators to share their work with the public while retaining their copyright, making it easier for others to use and build upon their creations.
crowne-plaza: A multinational chain of upscale hotels that caters to business travelers and conventions. The hotels offer a range of amenities, including meeting facilities, business services, and on-site restaurants, and are located in major city centers and resort locations worldwide.
cunard: A British cruise line that operates ocean liners on transatlantic voyages. It is known for its luxury cruise services and traditional maritime experience, offering voyages to a variety of destinations around the world.
daimler: A German multinational automotive corporation that manufactures and markets a variety of vehicles, including passenger cars, trucks, and buses. It is a major global manufacturer of commercial vehicles and has a strong presence in the automotive industry.
deezer: An online music streaming service that allows users to listen to a vast library of songs, playlists, and podcasts. It provides a platform for music discovery and offers personalized recommendations based on user listening habits.
delectable: A mobile application that allows users to discover, rate, and share wines. It uses image recognition technology to identify wines from a photo of the label and provides information, tasting notes, and ratings from other users.
delicious: A social bookmarking web service that allows users to save, organize, and share their favorite web pages. It uses a tagging system to help users categorize their bookmarks and discover new content from other users.
dell: A multinational technology company that develops, sells, and supports a wide range of computers, related products, and services. It is known for its desktop computers, laptops, servers, and other hardware products, and provides solutions for both individual consumers and large enterprises.
delta-airlines: A major American airline that provides passenger and cargo services to a large number of destinations worldwide. It operates a vast network of flights from its hubs and offers a variety of services, including domestic and international travel.
deviantart: An online community for artists and art enthusiasts. It provides a platform for members to showcase their artwork, get feedback, and connect with other creative individuals. The site features a wide range of art, including digital art, photography, and traditional art.
dhl: A German multinational courier, parcel, and express mail service. It provides logistics and shipping services for a variety of industries, including e-commerce, and has a global network for delivering packages and documents.
diebold: A multinational financial and security technology company that specializes in providing a variety of services and products for the financial industry. It is known for its automated teller machines (ATMs) and other self-service banking technology, as well as security systems.
dindr: A mobile application that helps users find and reserve tables at restaurants. It allows users to browse restaurants, view menus, and make reservations, and also provides a social aspect by allowing users to share their dining experiences.
direct-energy: An energy company that provides electricity, natural gas, and home services to residential and business customers. It offers various energy plans and services to help customers manage their energy usage and costs.
directv: An American direct broadcast satellite service provider. It delivers a wide variety of television channels, on-demand content, and pay-per-view services to subscribers through a satellite dish.
discogs: An online database and marketplace for music. It allows users to catalog their music collections, buy and sell records, and contribute to a comprehensive database of musical releases from around the world.
discord: A communication platform that allows users to create communities and chat with each other through voice, video, and text. It is popular with gamers and other online communities, and provides tools for creating private or public servers.
disney-xd: A multinational cable television channel that broadcasts animated and live-action television series for children and adolescents. It is known for airing content from a large media company's television and film properties.
dow-inc: A multinational chemical corporation that manufactures a wide range of chemical products, including plastics, specialty chemicals, and agricultural products. It provides materials science solutions for various industries, such as packaging, infrastructure, and consumer goods.
dribbble: An online community for digital designers and creative professionals. It serves as a platform for designers to showcase their work, known as 'shots', and provides a space for creative individuals to find inspiration and connect with each other.
dropbox: A file hosting service that provides cloud storage, file synchronization, and personal cloud services. It allows users to store and share files, as well as collaborate on documents with others.
drupal: A free and open-source content management framework. It provides a back-end framework for at least 12% of the top 10,000 websites worldwide and offers a flexible platform for building websites and digital experiences.
duckduckgo: A search engine that focuses on user privacy. It does not track users' search history or personal information, and aims to provide an alternative to other search engines that collect and use personal data.
duolingo: A language-learning platform that provides free courses in a variety of languages. It uses a gamified approach to language education, with interactive lessons and exercises that help users learn new vocabulary and grammar.
easy-jet: A low-cost airline that operates a variety of domestic and international flights. It is known for its no-frills service model, which allows it to offer affordable air travel to a wide range of destinations.
ebay: A multinational e-commerce company that provides an online marketplace for consumers and businesses to buy and sell goods and services. It facilitates online auctions and 'buy it now' sales for a vast range of products.
emma: A financial management application that helps users track their spending, manage their budgets, and analyze their finances. It connects to users' bank accounts to provide a consolidated view of their financial situation.
epam: A multinational IT services and software engineering company that provides a variety of technology services, including software development, digital platform engineering, and IT consulting. It works with businesses to help them with their digital transformation.
epictions: A platform for managing and organizing intellectual property, such as patents and trademarks. It provides tools for businesses to track their intellectual assets and streamline the process of protecting their innovations.
esl-faceit-group: A company that organizes and broadcasts esports tournaments and leagues. It provides a platform for professional gamers to compete and for fans to watch live matches and events.

evaneos: An online platform that connects travelers with local travel agents to create custom-made trips. It allows users to plan unique and authentic travel experiences by working directly with experts in the destination.

fairfield-inn-suites: A hotel brand that provides a variety of accommodations for travelers. The hotels are designed with a focus on providing comfortable and simple stays, and are often located near major highways and attractions.

fiskars: A Finnish company that provides a range of consumer products for the home, garden, and outdoors. It is known for its orange-handled scissors and other tools for crafting, gardening, and kitchen use.

five-guys: A fast-casual restaurant chain that specializes in serving hamburgers, hot dogs, and french fries. The restaurants are known for their customizable menu and a focus on fresh ingredients.

generatepress: A lightweight and fast WordPress theme that is designed to be highly customizable and accessible. It is often used by developers and designers to create websites that are optimized for speed and performance.

gibson: A company that manufactures guitars and other musical instruments. It is known for its electric and acoustic guitars, which have been used by many famous musicians throughout history.
github: A web-based platform for version control and collaboration on software development projects. It allows developers to host and review code, manage projects, and build software alongside millions of other developers.
gitlab: A web-based DevOps platform that provides a complete set of tools for the software development lifecycle. It includes features for version control, continuous integration, and continuous deployment, and is used by developers to manage their projects.
gitter: A chat and messaging platform for developers and software projects. It is a communication tool that allows developers to collaborate in real-time on open-source projects.
glaxosmithkline: A multinational pharmaceutical company that develops, manufactures, and markets a variety of pharmaceutical products, vaccines, and consumer healthcare products. It focuses on research and development to create new treatments for a wide range of diseases.
goethe-institut: A non-profit association that promotes a particular country's culture and language around the world. It offers language courses, cultural events, and information about the country's society and politics.
gogo: A provider of in-flight connectivity and entertainment solutions. It offers internet access, live television, and on-demand content to passengers on commercial and business aircraft.
google: A multinational technology company that specializes in internet-related services and products. It provides a wide range of services, including a search engine, online advertising, cloud computing, and software and hardware development.
gospel-for-asia: A Christian mission organization that provides humanitarian aid and a spiritual message to people in Asia. It works to provide clean water, education, and other forms of support to communities in need.
gravit: A free vector graphics design application that allows users to create a variety of designs, including illustrations, icons, and presentations. It provides a platform for graphic designers to create and edit vector-based artwork.
great-western-railway: A British train operating company that provides rail services in a specific region. It operates a network of intercity, commuter, and regional train services, connecting major cities and towns.
gucci: An Italian fashion company that produces a range of luxury goods, including leather goods, footwear, and accessories. It is known for its high-end fashion designs and is a major player in the luxury goods industry.
gumtree: A classified advertising and community website that allows users to buy and sell goods and services in their local area. It is a platform for finding everything from used cars and furniture to jobs and real estate.
gemeentelijk-vervoerbedrijf: A public transport company in a specific city. It operates a network of metro, tram, bus, and ferry services to transport people throughout the city and surrounding areas.
heineken: A Dutch brewing company that produces and sells a variety of beers and ciders. It is a major global brewer and has a presence in many countries around the world.
help-scout: A help desk software that provides a platform for customer support teams to manage and respond to customer inquiries. It offers features like shared inboxes, live chat, and knowledge base creation to help businesses provide efficient customer service.
highfive: A video conferencing platform that provides a solution for conducting online meetings and presentations. It offers features like screen sharing, high-definition video, and integrated hardware to facilitate collaboration.
hootsuite: A social media management platform that helps businesses and individuals manage their social media accounts. It provides tools for scheduling posts, monitoring social media activity, and analyzing performance across multiple platforms.
hulu: An American on-demand streaming service that offers a library of television shows, movies, and original content. It provides a platform for viewers to stream a variety of entertainment content on different devices.
hyatt: A multinational hospitality company that operates a large portfolio of hotels and resorts. It provides a variety of lodging options for business and leisure travelers, with a focus on delivering high-quality service and amenities.
ideal: A Dutch payment method that allows users to make secure online payments directly from their bank account. It is a popular payment system in a specific country and is widely used for e-commerce transactions.
identi-ca: A social networking and micro-blogging service that allows users to share short messages, or 'dents', with their followers. It is a decentralized platform that provides an alternative to other social networks.
ifttt: A web-based service that allows users to create chains of simple conditional statements, known as 'applets'. It connects different web services and devices, enabling users to automate tasks and create personalized connections between various applications.
instagram: A social media platform that allows users to share photos and videos with their followers. It provides a platform for visual storytelling and offers features like filters, direct messaging, and live video.

ios: A mobile operating system that is used on a variety of mobile devices. It provides a user interface that is known for its simplicity and fluid design, and is used to run a wide range of mobile applications.

knight-foundation: A foundation that supports journalism, arts, and community initiatives in a number of American cities. It provides grants and other forms of support to organizations that are working to improve their communities.

lego: A Danish toy company that produces a line of construction toys consisting of interlocking plastic bricks. The toys are used to build a variety of models, including buildings, vehicles, and robots.

reddit: A social news aggregation, web content rating, and discussion website where registered users submit content that is organized by subject into user-created boards.
redox: A chemical process involving the transfer of electrons between two substances, where one substance is oxidized (loses electrons) and the other is reduced (gains electrons).
renaissance-hotels: An upscale brand of hotels acquired by a major hotel corporation.
rit: A private research university in Rochester, New York.
rolls-royce: A British company that designs and manufactures luxury automobiles and aerospace, defense, and power systems.
roo-kids: A children's brand that provides apparel, accessories, and toys.

shazam: An app that identifies songs playing anywhere, allowing users to play, save, and share them.

slack: A platform for work that brings together people, processes, and data into one conversational interface through dedicated channels.

sony: The electronics business unit of a larger group that conducts research, development, and marketing for electronic products.
soulcycle: A high-intensity indoor cycling cardio workout that combines climbs, sprints, choreography, and weights.
sprout-social: A social media management tool that helps businesses publish and schedule posts, analyze data, and engage with their audience.
stack-exchange: A network of question-and-answer websites on diverse topics, where users contribute and moderate content through a reputation system.
stackoverflow: A question-and-answer platform for computer programmers.

stockton-university: A public university in New Jersey that offers an interdisciplinary approach to liberal arts, sciences, and professional education.
storyful: A social media intelligence company that offers services like social news monitoring, video licensing, and risk management tools for corporate clients.
subway: A multinational fast food restaurant franchise that specializes in submarine sandwiches and wraps.
sugarcrm: A customer relationship management (CRM) software company that provides functionality for sales-force automation, marketing campaigns, and customer support.
suntrust: A financial institution that focuses its lending activities on consumer and corporate finance.
taiga: A biome characterized by coniferous forests, also known as boreal or snow forest.
teamspeak: A proprietary voice-over-Internet Protocol application service for audio communication between users on a chat channel.
temple: A public state-related research university in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
texas-am-university: A public, land-grant, research university located in College Station, Texas.
the-audience-awards: An award at a film festival that is selected by the attending audience rather than a jury.
the-next-web: A website and conference series focused on new technology and startup companies.
the-ritz-carlton: A multinational company that operates a luxury hotel chain.
thomson-reuters: A Canadian multinational content-driven technology conglomerate.
tivo: A digital video recorder that provides an on-screen guide of broadcast programming and allows for recording.
trello: A web-based, kanban-style, list-making application that helps teams manage projects.
trustpilot: A Danish consumer review website that hosts reviews of businesses worldwide.
twentythree: A video management software designed to optimize video content creation, distribution, and analytics for businesses.
twitch: An American live-streaming service popular for video games, creative content, and music broadcasts.
twitter: A micro-blogging service that allows users to post short messages and engage in conversations.
uber: An American multinational transportation company that provides ride-hailing services, food delivery, and freight transport.
ubuntu: A Linux distribution based on Debian that is composed of free and open-source software.
uc-berkeley: A public land-grant research university in Berkeley, California.
uc-san-francisco: A public land-grant research university in San Francisco, California, dedicated entirely to health and life sciences.
united-way: An international network of local nonprofit fundraising affiliates.
unity: A cross-platform game engine developed by an American video game software development company.
universitat-hamburg: A public research university in Germany.
university-at-albany: A public university in Albany, New York.
university-at-buffalo: A public research university in Buffalo, New York.
university-of-cambridge: A collegiate research university in Cambridge, United Kingdom.
university-of-dayton: A private Catholic research university in Dayton, Ohio.
university-of-north-carolina: A public university system in North Carolina.
university-of-texas: A public university system with multiple institutions across Texas.
university-of-victoria: A public research university in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada.
university-of-washington: A public research university in Seattle, Washington.
university-of-wisconsin-milwaukee: A public urban research university located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
united-postal-service: A federal agency that provides mail processing and delivery services to individuals and businesses.
united-states-postal-service: A federal agency that provides mail processing and delivery services to individuals and businesses in the U.S.

walmart: A multi-channel retailer that operates grocery stores, hypermarkets, and e-commerce platforms.

western-digital: An American data storage company that manufactures hard disk drives and other storage solutions.

whatsbroadcast: A communication tool that allows businesses to create distribution lists to send a single message to multiple recipients.

wikipedia: A collaborative online encyclopedia that provides information on all branches of knowledge.
windows: A series of operating systems for personal computers and other computing devices, known for its user-friendly interface.
woocommerce: An e-commerce plugin for a popular content management system that simplifies creating and managing an online store.
